page.title: 02ECOLOGY,GEOLOGICAL STRUCTURE
page.content: The area is composed of sedimentary rocks of Old Red Sandstone (Devonian) age, these being grits and sandstones which are red in colour. The soils are light and acid. Much of the top of Fforest Fach is covered with peat. Evidence of Quaternary glaciation is to be found in the two valleys where there are morainic deposits. There is a prominent (but hitherto undescribed) terminal moraine in Cwm Treweren at TRE'R-DOMEN in the North East corner of this area. The local rocks are well-exposed in a disused quarry located on the eastern slopes of Fforest Fach above Forest Cottage and Pantymaes farm. It should be noted, however, that this is not a place for unsupervised visits and indiscriminate scrambling.
